metadata.title: CVE-2024-27044 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amd/display: Fix potential NULL pointer dereferences in'dcn10_set_output_transfer_func()' The 'stream' pointer is used indcn10_set_output_transfer_func() before the check if 'stream' is NULL.Fixes the below:drivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/../display/dc/hwss/dcn10/dcn10_hwseq.c:1892dcn10_set_output_transfer_func() warn: variable dereferenced before check'stream' (see line 1875)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
